test.name: 打开App

kw.name: Open Application
kw.doc: Opens a new application to given Appium server.

kw.name: Capture Page Screenshot
kw.doc: Takes a screenshot of the current page and embeds it into the log.
kw.msg: Traceback (most recent call last): File "<decorator-gen-32>", line 2, in capture_page_screenshot File "D:\Python27\lib\site-packages\AppiumLibrary\keywords\keywordgroup.py", line 15, in _run_on_failure_decorator return method(*args, **kwargs) File "D:\Python27\lib\site-packages\AppiumLibrary\keywords\_screenshot.py", line 31, in capture_page_screenshot if hasattr(self._current_application(), 'get_screenshot_as_file'): File "D:\Python27\lib\site-packages\AppiumLibrary\keywords\_applicationmanagement.py", line 285, in _current_application raise RuntimeError('No application is open')
Keyword 'Capture Page Screenshot' could not be run on failure: No application is open

WebDriverException: Message: An unknown server-side error occurred while processing the command. Original error: Could not find aapt Please set the ANDROID_HOME environment variable with the Android SDK root directory path.

Traceback (most recent call last): File "<decorator-gen-36>", line 2, in open_application File "D:\Python27\lib\site-packages\AppiumLibrary\keywords\keywordgroup.py", line 15, in _run_on_failure_decorator return method(*args, **kwargs) File "D:\Python27\lib\site-packages\AppiumLibrary\keywords\_applicationmanagement.py", line 52, in open_application application = webdriver.Remote(str(remote_url), desired_caps) File "D:\Python27\lib\site-packages\appium\webdriver\webdriver.py", line 97, in __init__ super(WebDriver, self).__init__(command_executor, desired_capabilities, browser_profile, proxy, keep_alive) File "D:\Python27\lib\site-packages\selenium\webdriver\remote\webdriver.py", line 154, in __init__ self.start_session(desired_capabilities, browser_profile) File "D:\Python27\lib\site-packages\appium\webdriver\webdriver.py", line 136, in start_session response = self.execute(RemoteCommand.NEW_SESSION, parameters) File "D:\Python27\lib\site-packages\selenium\webdriver\remote\webdriver.py", line 312, in execute self.error_handler.check_response(response) File "D:\Python27\lib\site-packages\selenium\webdriver\remote\errorhandler.py", line 242, in check_response raise exception_class(message, screen, stacktrace)
